Key Match Events: Corbin Carroll hit an inside-the-park home run in the first inning after back-to-back-to-back home runs from Los Angeles' Shohei Ohtani, Mookie Betts, and Freddie Freeman.
Pre-Game Insights: The Diamondbacks-Dodgers rivalry has heated up in the past year, as Arizona knocked out Los Angeles in the NLDS last October and is fighting to stay within striking distance for the NL West entering September.
Post-Match Reflections: Arizona manager Torey Lovullo said, 'There was a lot of excitement in this building. I felt the energy. The fans were engaged. There were a lot of fireworks for the first two innings.... It felt like we did enough to stay in this game.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The attendance on Saturday was 50,041, the second-largest regular season crowd at Chase Field.
